okay so i want to talk a bit about distraction and procrastination specifically so
procrastination is uh something that we all will suffer with it's when
you should be working on something uh something quite important but maybe you're not quite as engaged with what it is that you're supposed to be doing so
maybe your managers ask you to do a report or maybe in your scrum for that week you've
been assigned one of the really grotty tasks that you're not really interested in and you kind of delay doing the work
um someone wrote tax returns yeah tell me about it that's why i think it's very
procrastination worthy and you know i used to be very bad with procrastination my wife in fact used to call me half a job steve because i just
you know i've had his grand idea or something i want to do and then i start it and then get bored and then just move
on i mean like everyone else i've got a github repo which is like a graveyard of
half finished projects so
come on powerpoint don't let me down today okay so procrastination is the habit of putting off or delaying
especially something requiring immediate attention so something we should be doing we know
it's important but we put it off to the last minute and then we kind of have a mad rush at the end
to try and get something done which normally results in us producing something of you know not great quality not our best
quality work so some of the dangers of procrastination we can stop you
achieving your goals because you don't put the effort into to achieve them you know if you want to
achieve things in life if you want to get better at things you kind of have to turn up and put the effort in but if you keep putting off that work because maybe
you're not completely engaged or you're distracted and it's going to stop you from achieving those goals also you know it stops you from acting
quite literally because you're you know more preoccupied with cat videos on youtube or twitter then you are actually getting
the work done it doesn't push you to challenge yourself because by its very nature by
procrastinating you're literally just doing you know the minimum you can get away with just to get something finished and
this in turn produces elevated stress levels because the work has to be done you know if if you've committed to your
team that you're gonna you know do a certain amount of tickets within a scrum for example
and you put some of that work off it still has to be done so you end up rushing at the end and it elevates your stress levels which isn't healthy
so why do we procrastinate so one of the most common ones is a fear of failure so if we're having to work on something
that's maybe new that we've not done before maybe it's a new area of coding that we're not familiar
with or it could be a writing project that you're doing that you're not as comfortable with as what you would
hope you know sometimes you can have this fear of messing it up so you know if i mess this up what my colleagues going to think of me are they going to
think i'm a complete loser are they going to think i'm an idiot and kind of that fear can be a bit paralyzing sometimes and it can kind of
put you off from acting procrastinators can often be perfectionists
and so if you're working on something you just don't want to let it go until it's absolutely perfect
and that can sometimes be a bit debilitating because because you kind of have that fear about what you're working on it's not going to be the best that it
can absolutely be you can kind of tend to put you off delaying starting that piece of work
low energy levels are also a big problem with this
um if you're feeling generally tired all the time so if you have got into a habit
of going to bed too late and you know you literally the first thing you do or the last thing you do before you go to bed
is you've got a screen in front of you you know that can affect your sleep patterns you wake up tired in the
morning or if the kids wake you up so i'm sure anyone here who parents can vouch for this and when you've got young
children waking you up at an ungodly hour it just gives you low energy levels and that can make you you know not as optimal as you should be
and also you know the last one here is a you know there's millions of millions of reasons why we procrastinate i'm just picking on kind
of four but you know there could be a general lack of focus so if you're just not engaged in the work that you're doing
and you know if you're normally a back-end developer but you've been asked to help out some
front-end stuff and it just really does not interest you and you're not focused on it then you know it can make you
not focus on what you're doing
so there's a few sort of key areas that you can do to kind of decrease your chances for
procrastinating and so one of them is accepting that we are not perfect um
everyone has things that they're good at and everyone has things that they're necessarily not so good at but you know we're not perfect i know some people try
to come across as though they're perfect but we're not you know we're going to do things we're going to mess things up and that's fine you know if you
in fact failing at something or doing something wrong is can ultimately be a benefit to you because
you're going to be learning from that experience so except that you're not perfect you know if you're going to build something
um that you've in a technology you've not used before you know you probably are going to mess a few things up you know you might have
an awkward code review with a with a peer doesn't matter we're not perfect
also failure is not fatal you know if you do something a little bit wrong or it's not as good as it can be you know
unless of course you're working in a safety critical system or you're working on a you know nuclear power station you know no one's
going to die off the back of a mistake it's not fatal you know the world's not going to end
so if you kind of realize that and you know if you do make a mistake you just need to put it right it's you know
generally it's not a big deal so aim to do your best to be happy about the output
because it sounds very simple to say that but sometimes you just need to think that you know i've done some work if you are
